reviews.review:
I was able to make millions using soy beans. And now I have a tractor for every container or plow (never have to disconnect)
 and I divide up my farm into four sections (upper left, upper right, lower left, and  lower right) which I farm during each month as I change sections that I am working on (while fertilizing the previous section also as I work clockwise) This is a casual and relaxing game highly recommended for low stress cozy gamers. Also, I store all my soy beans to sell in June in large containers with trucks attached and just park and sit them until June. I also have dedicated plows for each of the four sections with tractors attached and all small fertilizers have a mini tractor attached to it as do all of my transport container.

I literally do not have to disconnect or connect anything every month. I just get in the tractor and work.

I recommend doing the German farm into four sections as it is easier.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement an automated equipment management system allowing players to pre-assign tractors and tools to specific fields or tasks for seamless workflow.

reviews.review:
Was torn whether to give 1 or 5 stars, been playing for 2-3 years and have always thought it was an awesome near-perfect game— easily 5+ stars. Over the past 1-2 months, it has been and still is CONSTANTLY crashing. I submitted a message to support team via ninja kiwi’s website several weeks ago to make them aware if they weren’t already. Before I did that, I had given it plenty of time to resolve after making absolutely sure the softwares for both the game and my iPhone were up-to-date. It’s been a few weeks since submitting that message, and it is STILL crashing. I’ve been trying to get black borders on maps, and in EVERY CHIMPS ATTEMPT I DO ON ANY MAP IT ALWAYS CRASHES, which prevents me from getting the black borders!! EVEN ON THE BASIC HARD DIFFICULTY LEVEL, it crashes WELL BEFORE round 80. Every. Single. Freakin. Game. It is so frustrating and it having been happening for as long as it has, as often as it does, has gotten ridiculous. Please either change the freaking chimps so you can still get the chimps medal with black eyes (and thus black border) when the game crashes, or fix the crashes. 

The game used to only crash when my son and I would play co-op and get into rounds 140+, and that would be infuriating and ridiculous when at least one of us would always be kicked and completely lose access to re-join the game. Now it’s crashing on solo games sometimes before round 60, always before round 80, and it completely messes up the opportunity to get the medals/borders for maps that ninja kiwi designed to be a part of the game! Sorry rant over. Please fix. This is ridic.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement an auto-save feature for game progress in single-player modes, especially for challenging difficulties like CHIMPS, to prevent lost progress due to crashes.

reviews.review:
This app feels frustrating to navigate and a waste of money. Why are the free Anki imitations easier to use? It’s no wonder why the knockoffs are more popular when this app costs $25 and looks like it hasn’t been updated in over a decade, and the free versions offer better features. For example, when viewing all cards in a deck, the only option is to browse by the front of the cards only. Very tiresome when needing to sort through cards for language learning purposes when it doesn’t show you the translation as well. Why can’t this app display the cards’ front and backs simultaneously?

Second, do the creators know that the free versions of this app automatically translate words into your desired language when you put them in new cards? For $25, why can’t this app do the same?

This app does not seem relevant anymore. There are plenty of better alternatives out there for FREE. Please do not waste your money.

reviews.review:
They have an automatic selection tool that works in a straightforward, low-tech way (adjacent pixel contrast detection, more or less). That would be fine for my collage- and meme-making purposes HOWEVER you cannot paint directly onto a mask. 

Your options for modifying the mask directly are either A) use the built-in selection tools (with the underlying layer turned off, so you can see the mask clearly) or B) use brushes and black/white to modify it ONLY with the underlying layer turned on. There is no rendering the mask alone in its plain black-and-white form so you can see clearly if there are any spots you missed. 

It's also unfortunate because you lose access to a lot of cool effects that are achievable by applying filters to masks. It's so vexing because you can see the underlying mask in its true black-and-white form in the thumbnail for the mask, there's just no working on it in full screen. So close but so far, very disappointing to omit this valuable feature.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a 'Mask Only' full-screen editing mode that allows users to view and directly paint on a mask in its true black-and-white form, separate from the underlying image layer.

reviews.review:
First thing I wanna say is I really like the gameplay. I’ve probably had this game since mid 2010s and the fact that I still come back to it sometimes says a lot. 

HOWEVER, like many others have already said, there’s content I paid REAL MONEY for back in the day that I no longer have access to. Decks and grips I paid for back in the day are completely gone without a trace. A 3 pack of maps I bought show up but only 1 of the 3 will load. The others say “invalid lighting data”. It gives the instructions to delete the content and redownload but nothing works.

The fact that they are asking you to pay a subscription for all features of the game when they don’t even take care of the OGs who got them to where they are now is a disgrace. 

ZERO BIG BOOMS ❌💪
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a robust system for verifying and re-granting past in-app purchases to users who can prove ownership, especially for content that was previously purchased with real money.

reviews.review: Had this since about 2015-16. I have SLS 16 maps that are on my account on my iPod touch but for some reason not on on my phone(iPhone 15). I have many decks and grip tape bundles purchased with real money that are just gone. Support responds whenever they feel like it or they just don’t. Connecting accounts is painstakingly hard for no reason at all. Always a problem trying to get Facebook or Apple to connect. The gameplay and idea is there. However I’m afraid the developers are dull and money hungry. Stop pushing for buying all this paid content when it randomly disappears so there is no point. And stop adding new content and not fixing old bugs. “Missing Light Data” on a mobile game map? Seriously? Even small unity developers don’t throw errors like that. Fix it!
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a robust account synchronization system to ensure purchased content and game data are consistently available across linked devices, alongside improved customer support responsiveness.

reviews.review: Sadly I recommend against purchasing StS for iPhone.  The touch controls are highly unreliable.  I have fairly slender fingers and I’m dextrous, using iPhone 13 Pro Max, and even when being very careful selecting cards, I still miss fairly often.  The 2nd to left-most card is super difficult to select to discard.  Selecting a card to discard will often result in the wrong card being thrown away, regardless of how careful you are to touch it directly.  Also, after touching a card, it remains weirdly “sticky” — i.e. it often won’t go back into your hand, and you have to carefully click around your other cards, hoping to deselect it, lest it be played.  The issues are fairly constant; definitely recommend not spending $10 on this.  Just play on PC.
reviews.potential_idea: Introduce a 'tap-and-hold' or 'delayed select' option for card actions to improve touch precision and reduce accidental selections.

reviews.review:
I adore this game, have sunk a ridiculous amount of hours into it but wanted to come leave some feedback for the devs that the latest update has added a lot of frustration to my experience on iOS (iPhone XS if it matters). Cards in my hand have gotten super sticky - very often when I tap to select they don’t rise high enough up to be able to read the text and I’ll have to tap them up and down 3 or 4 times, often have to tap a different card and go back to it before it’ll pop up properly. 

I’m methodical enough that it hasn’t led to too many misplays, and I’m never too proud to scum save when it does…but it does make my turns take a lot longer and adds a lot of extra tapping and frustration. 

It was running fine for years so I was surprised to see anything change this late into the game. So while on one hand I’m happy to see this game is still getting some dev love on mobile, on the other all it’s caused me is grief lol so hopefully they’re still up for some more tweaking! It’ll be an easy 5 stars with this one gripe fixed. Thanks!
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a more responsive and robust card selection mechanism in the game to prevent 'sticky card' issues on iOS devices.

reviews.review:
Update 3/27/25: I really appreciate the devs responding and I also really really liked the app (as you can see from my crazy long review below), but I had to eventually un-install it a from my shortcuts a few days after DL.    

When I had it installed (I have an iPhone 15 pro max, so not a old-ish iPhone btw. Also I use safari as my phone Internet browser) web pages would not load correctly. I would have to re-load the web pages pretty much all the time or sometimes re-loading wouldn’t work and everything on the page would just look wonky. I really wanted this to work because like I said in my review, I have light sensitivity & I prefer my phone to be on dark mode (I can read everything better and it doesn’t hurt my eyes so much) and some websites are now having options to be able to change to dark mode or will automatically change if that is your phones settings. But the majority don’t have that yet so their background will be white. I have “night shift” turned on for websites like that, but sometimes it’s not enough and still will hurt my eyes/give me a headache. 

Anyways, it just didn’t work for me. I had to un-install it because I was getting too frustrated with having to re-load sites, sites looking super weird and sites crashing all the time. I wasn’t really sure what was going wrong but I thought maybe it had something to do with the noir extension and as soon as I turned it off safari started working fine. 
Bummed!
———-

Just purchased the app and I felt like I had to write a review to tell the devs thank you! I have really bad photophobia/light sensitivity, especially in the evening & at night, that causes super bad headaches and makes my eyes ache and hurt. I switch anything I can to dark mode, night shift etc. I even sometimes wear these goofy light sensitivity glasses (they block specific wavelengths of light). For a long time now I was so annoyed I couldn’t change all of safari on dark mode (a few websites I could but that’s it). I found this app randomly tonight and immediately bought and downloaded it. The instructions to install it on safari were very clear and I had it up and running in just a few minutes. The app also has other colors/themes you can choose besides just black which I thought was pretty cool if someone wants to change it to sepia instead or something. Also the app itself looks really nice and I thought for what it does I would have paid more than $3 for it so I appreciate the devs for keeping it at that price. Anyways, ty to the devs for making this!!
reviews.potential_idea: Develop an integrated dark mode feature for Safari that automatically applies a dark theme to all websites, even those without native dark mode support, and offers customizable color options.

reviews.review:
While at first this app may have been one of the few around, there are far better resources. Being able to utilize Googles AI allows you to quickly search for specific foods. 

SEARCH: horrible search. I often get nothing related to my search, even as simple as a banana gets mixed results. 

RECIPES: there are maybe 20 recipes. They all stem from white American cuisine. Also, it mixes a lot with being healthy. Having minimal recipes that do not display diverse flavors really cuts your results.
reviews.potential_idea: Expand recipe database with diverse global cuisines and offer a customizable dietary/cuisine filter.

reviews.review: Doesn’t allow refunds? What a scam. This is supposed to be a database of foods with fodmap scores but they don’t have any foods that a normal person would eat, just a bunch of expensive foods that are already labeled as low fodmap. Good luck finding any items from a regular grocery store. I wasted $8 on a useless app when I have to Google the fodmap content of any foods i actually plan to eat.
reviews.potential_idea: Expand the app's food database to include common grocery store items and offer a refund option or a more robust free trial.

reviews.review: There are free app that give more details with regards to serving size and max serving size. It’s very surprising that Monash doesn’t do the same. Potatoes for example. My Dre app shows the percentage of each fod map it also says how many potatoes ( and size i.e medium potatoes) you can it and it still remain low fod map. MoNash on the other hand says 1/4 cup but up 500g. In my opinion it’s not informative enough and comes across as lazy.
reviews.potential_idea: Enhance the Monash app with detailed serving size information, including percentage breakdown of FODMAPs per serving and clear guidance on allowable quantities for low-FODMAP consumption, similar to competitor apps.

Has really strange ranges too, for something like cornichons it will tell you 1.76oz is fine, then 17.07oz is in the yellow zone. I could see someone eating like 3oz of them, but who is eating almost a pound? Why not represent this in a more simplistic way. 

Finally, when you click “start the diet”, it just tells you what the diet is like, no more information than what you could find on Google, it doesn’t actually start anything for you. No calendar, nothing, you need to go find a dietitian to do it for you.

On one of my runs I watch the claw go down and grab a bunch of items and right when it started to come up one of the items I was going for immediately disappeared. When it's the games mechanic I can't get past it. I will never play this game again and wasted the money I spent on it. I hate free to play but this game makes me want to just play free to play so I am not wasting money like this. I am very disappointed. I like this game. It's pretty entertaining. I just bought it today and I am on my first run. I am on floor 16 and just started to notice stuff disappearing. So 2 turns I watched the magnet drop in the machine and immediately disappear. Third turn it drops lands on the other stuff and when I went to grab it, it disappeared. Next stage same floor I watched stuff fall and immediately disappear. The reason such a low rating is grabbing stuff is the whole point of the game. Can't grab stuff if it doesn't drop or show up like it should. Please fix.

The player needs a left and right arrow he can tap to move the claw in finer increments.  Not going to play this game as it is right now unless these features are added

reviews.review:
TLDR: find another app. I was a power user with things, but it no longer fits my needs. 

I never thought I’d write this. Things has always been the best. Always the sharpest looking. Always ready for productivity. Always in Apple’s spotlight. But Things has been slowing down…

Today, iOS 26 launched. I woke up hopeful that Things would surprise us by giving us a new feature. Maybe a new UI refresh. Nope. Their update was a barebones update to stay “current”. A glass icon and a glassy like plus button. Wooo thanks! 

I have bought every version of things. The visionOS release was strike one. A full price for a multi year app that just has translucent sidebars? Come on. I messaged the devs many times asking what most of us are asking and needing: attachment support, better markdown (the current setup is insanely stupid), collaboration, or even a refreshed coat of paint to not look like an older app. The responses we get? Thanks for the feedback, we aren’t doing it. 

Today, I’m uninstalling things. This big update from them is a joke. To the other devs who listen and keep the magic of Apple software release day still magical, thank you. To Cultured Code, thanks for the great years ranging all the way back to Things 1. You’ve lost your touch, your magic. I hope you find it again and find joy in your work.
reviews.potential_idea: Develop a task management app that prioritizes advanced markdown support, robust attachment capabilities, and seamless collaboration features.

reviews.review: I need REPEATED daily tasks. Pointless app if it doesn’t do that. It’s also ATROCIOUS to find out that if I want it on my laptop I have to pay another $50????? I would really like a refund. I’ll stick to notion.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a robust recurring task system for daily tasks, offering a one-time purchase or a lower subscription cost for desktop access to avoid alienating users seeking basic functionality.

reviews.potential_idea: Implement a robust Markdown editor with advanced formatting options that allows users to easily hide or toggle the visibility of specific Markdown elements like links and code blocks.

Keep your money in your pocket and try other alternatives before dropping 60 bucks on this app (mac + iPhone)

Have been using Things for years and liked it. However, just had the worst experience trying to move away from it due to switching to an android phone. While platforms like todoist give you the option to export tasks, Things doesn’t and makes it as hard as possible to move your data out of their system. They give you a database file where half of information is missing such as projects, recurring reminders, etc. In the end I spent days getting a spreadsheet of my information and had to manually go through hundreds of records to update them. 
Unfortunately, I can no longer recommend them.
reviews.potential_idea: Develop a cross-platform task management app with robust data import/export capabilities, including support for common formats and full data fidelity.

I literally can’t even open the app because the second I do, it completely crashes. 

This issue started on my iPad and now on my iPhone. 

Thing is that there is NO way to access on a browser. This is not a good back up option. Especially when the app goes down. 

This is devastating. I’m in the middle of so many projects and everything is in this app. 

I am trying to figure out how to move everything to a more reliable app. 

Really disappointing. 

If you can’t be without your to-do list, I’d highly suggest a platform with a back up web browser.

reviews.review: The game itself is absolutely fine, a great TD game just like the rest in the series. For me it is a 1 out 5 for the simple fact that they have turned this into the greediest of cash grabs where something like 50% of all towers and 85% of all heroes are locked behind further paywalls, and not cheap ones either. Paying for all of these, event at their “discounts price” will cost you a further $50 on top of the price of the game itself. In other words, they want you to pay the price of a AAA console/PC game to play their mobile game. To add further insult to injury, most of the paid extras towers ar just towers from previous games, so you’re paying an entire games worth of blackmail money for the privilege of using them in this game, even if you bought those previous games. The same is true of the DLC heroes except it’s even worse - even if you ALREADY PAID for a DLC hero in a previous entry it isn’t credited to you in this game. I’m sure the actual designers didn’t make these decisions but the game is a shameful cash grab that’s unworthy of its own legacy.

reviews.review:
I have been a huge fan of the kingdom rush games since the first one came out, and these are the only mobile games I’ve ever actually paid for. Kingdom rush 5 upholds the graphics, creativity, and humor of the series but is unfortunately the weakest game out of all of them in my opinion.

I was disappointed to see the mechanism from the last game continue where you’re only allotted 5 tower types that you preselect before starting a level. This was my main criticism of the last game and why the last game was the first one that I didn’t enjoy as much. I miss the older mechanic where you could have up to 8 tower types available during gameplay, because it made it so much more interesting to strategize and it was more fun to see more variety on the map. I found myself never using a handful of towers through the whole play through because I was forced to prioritize which ones made it into gameplay. 

The levels themselves were not very challenging and they didn’t last long enough. I found myself barely getting any towers to be fully upgraded before I already beat the level, so I didn’t even get to fully utilize a lot of the tower skills. I beat the main campaign fairly quickly. There also weren’t any standout enemies, which made them all kind of meld together and made all the levels feel the same. There are still enemy types that I remember from the past games but none from this game really stuck with me. 

I don’t mind the extra towers and heroes behind the extra paywall. I didn’t purchase any of them and didn’t feel like I was missing out that much. I think this developer definitely deserves to find ways to make more revenue as long as the base game stays at a reasonable price, which I think it does at the moment. Despite the criticisms, the game still upholds a high caliber with its creativity, style, and mechanics. I might take pause at buying into another installment if it comes, but this series still remains to be one of the best made for mobile games, and I’ll likely continue to revisit some of the early installments for repeat play throughs.
reviews.potential_idea: Reintroduce a mechanic allowing players to access a larger variety of towers (e.g., up to 8) during gameplay in future Kingdom Rush installments.

reviews.review:
Nintendo thinks that in every situation where you change phones, you’ll remember to go into this game and use their one-of-a-kind save transfer tool (that keeps your data for 3 days) instead of using the built-in iOS option for completely seamless data backup.

This means your save, which you’ve worked on over the course of a year, likely multiple years, can be completely lost if your phone is stolen, broken, or lost. This is obviously stupid and they went out of their way to avoid using iCloud backup for reasons that I can’t fathom.

reviews.review: I absolutely adored this game when it was one of the few game options of the time, among solitaire and minefield. For years I’ve yearned for another chance to play the cake game, hear the sound effects and see the flying clovers… I was so excited to think I could finally relive those fond memories, however, this recreation hasn’t met my expectations, whatsoever. At first I thought $1.99 was a modest price for the revival of the Purble Place I remember, but this game simply isn’t it. Although most of the visuals are wonderful, I feel a lot more effort could have been put into the actual gameplay. I’ve never purchased a game from the App Store before, but I really got my hopes up. I don’t understand why or how this game could be worth the two dollars.

reviews.review: What is it now, 2005? Imagine an app that requires you to have a username and password. You have to come up with an original username so you are forced to try a bunch of things til you get one that nobody else has. Now a few years go by and you want to find more charts so you try to log in so you can access the forums. What was that username you made up on the fly when you first bought the app? Donn’t know it? You are out of luck. There’s a “forgot password” option, but no “forgot username” option. You spent 20-something dollars for the app, and it’s pegged to your Apple ID. You are using the same device, same Apple ID you had when you bought the app. But no, you are locked out. You won’t be getting in. Period.  So many things about this old, clunky app are just like this. Want to name a chart you just created? If a chart already exists for that song on any of the playlists you have previously downloaded, you will not be able to use that title. You’ll have to call your chart All Of Me 2, or something like that. You’ll find the whole app is riddled with nutty appendices on the names of common songs. It’s so freaking cumbersome amd clunky. It’s from a bygone era, but it’s what everyone uses for the time being, so it’s what you are stuck with.
reviews.potential_idea: Integrate a username recovery option or allow app login via Apple ID/email to prevent users from being locked out of their accounts and purchased content.

reviews.review: I wish I could tell what I think about what this app does. It might just be amazing. Certainly some people seem to think it is. However the needlessly complicated registration process had me fuming from the moment I started to register and after 45 minutes I never did get registered. I don't know whether I hate this app or not, but I certainly hate its registration process.
reviews.potential_idea: Simplify the app's registration process by offering a streamlined, one-click sign-up option or clear step-by-step guidance to reduce user frustration and increase onboarding completion rates.

reviews.review:
I’ve had this app for about 5 years, hopping back on to tweak an old beat or trying something new. Every, single, time, I would open this app, there would be another glitch in my beats that needs updated. For example, the kicks won’t work because I have to reinstall the input, or a certain effect doesn’t work anymore. Now, after experiencing that same issue and attempting to troubleshoot it, I decided to delete the app and reinstall it to see if that would fix it. I’ve done it in the past and it worked out so no problem. Except this time, ALL OF MY FILES WERE DELETED.
Every, single beat I’ve made or worked on for the past 5 years is gone. Poof! Countless hours of effort to craft my own sounds, just for it to corrupt in a bad app and get lost somewhere. I tried recovering them, nothing works and they’ve vanished. Now I don’t even want to touch this app or the computer version. 

Overall, the experience was fun, but I would recommend investing your time in a different program that’s more stable than this one. Otherwise, everything you’ve worked on may be randomly deleted.

P.S. I purchased half of all the add ons, after my initial purchase of the app, and this happened.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a robust cloud backup and sync feature for user projects to prevent data loss from local file corruption or accidental deletion.

reviews.review:
Haven’t seen much good things added in terms of features or bugfixes in a looooong time. 

- sending media from Photos app requires you to wait for the media to be encoded before you can add captions. You need to keep the send dialogue open until everything is sent, otherwise you loose your captions and you have to share from pictures again
- when sending multiple images/videos and one fails (eg network timeout), all media “after” that are lost and you have to share again from Photos app. 
- randomly people can’t receive/send messages for non-obvious reasons. No error messages whatsoever. We found out by accident when speaking IRL. Trusting the other’s Threema IDs resolved it
- extremely limited set of reaction emojis. Why can’t I use the full emoji pallet to express my emotions
- can’t port data backups from android to iOS???
- when you are offline for some time and get online again you are spammed by notifications, instead of Threema batching them in a single notification/one per chat

Threema for Desktop is the only good addition that I’ve seen in 5+ years. 

I don’t see a reason to pay for Threema when there are better alternatives (Signal being the obvious one)
reviews.potential_idea: Implement background media encoding and resumable multi-file uploads to prevent data loss and improve user experience for sending media.

reviews.app_name: e-Sword LT: Bible Study to Go
reviews.review:
Here are my three main groups with this app…

1. This is not a KJV with Apocrypha because it’s missing books. It’s missing history of Susanna, Bel Of The dragon and the Prayer of Mannesah.
2. Unlike other Bible apps, it does not sink across your different devices. He wants you to pay a fee for each device like your desktop, iPad and iPhone. Why not charge one flat fee and they sync across all devices? 
3. And this last one could be just a personal preference. Why do I have to hold down the scripture every time to add adjustments to a note already established. I should be able to click on that note one time to add or delete commentary or precepts.

Lastly, I want to say that I don’t have a problem paying for this app and it services. It has potential. But the fact that I’m paying for a app that’s incomplete in my opinion because it’s missing books is unfair. Hopefully there will be some updates that can get this fixed.
reviews.potential_idea: A universal subscription model for Bible apps that allows seamless syncing of notes, bookmarks, and reading progress across all a user's devices (phone, tablet, desktop) for a single flat fee.

Please update your games and stop this from happening. I have purchased pretty much every one of your titles and I even spend money in them outside of the initial purchase price. But, it’s become very annoying that every time I’m done playing one of them. That the App Store opens without my permission. That just seems like malware activity if I’m honest. 

Again, please would you update your games and stop them from doing this annoying behavior?

Outside of this problem I really enjoy so many of the Papa Louie’s video games a lot. I’ve played quite a few of them to completion. I definitely would recommend their titles but I just wish they would get rid of this annoying tactic please. Thank you.

reviews.review:
I’ve been vegetarian for 30 years and vegan for about 15. During this time, I heard about this app but always managed fine in the various places I lived and traveled (international and domestic). 

I finally ended up paying for the app about 2 months ago when I found myself in a village in Basque country where there was rarely vegetarian food on menus and a number of restaurants that did have more veg options were closed. No options were listed on HappyCow. Walking around, I eventually found a restaurant that offered a salad that could be made vegetarian or vegan and it was delicious. I took the time to submit this restaurant and meal to HappyCow, as I was very thankful to have found it and wished it had been something I’d found when checking the app. My submission was rejected because the restaurant serves primarily non-vegetarian food, which was disappointing. 

I continued to try to use the app in France and Spain over the next several weeks. HappyCow never once helped me find a vegetarian or vegan place to eat. There were either 1–2 listings with one or two bad reviews or there were simply no listings. 

I felt like I was using an app that had been abandoned. It was a ghost town. 

I’ll keep using Yelp and Google to find vegetarian/vegan food — I’ve had much more luck with these free tools.

Edit in response to developer response: I appreciate that this is a small team; however, the app was a disappointment for me, a vegan, and my personal experience is that Yelp and Google are more accurate and up to date.
reviews.potential_idea: Enhance the app's search and filtering capabilities to include more granular options for identifying restaurants with flexible vegetarian/vegan options, even if not exclusively vegetarian/vegan establishments.

It’s far from user-friendly—my employees found the interface confusing and frustrating to navigate, leading to constant issues with scheduling.

When we reached out to customer service and tech support for help, the experience was equally disappointing. The support team was unhelpful, and the issues persisted without resolution. After wasting time and energy, we switched to a much more user-friendly scheduling software that actually works for our team. I strongly recommend avoiding HotSchedules—it’s a headache not worth dealing with.

reviews.potential_idea: Allow users to enable offline access or a one-time purchase option to bypass recurring or organizational purchase restrictions.

reviews.review: Have the app on another device now it’s asking me to pay again for the same feature an additional 6 dollars
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a universal subscription or account-based system for features to avoid repeated purchases across devices.

reviews.review: Great concept, but only if you can upload the photos to be used by other programs.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a feature to export photos from the app in a format compatible with other external programs.

reviews.review: Doesn’t work great with iPhone 16. Takes 15-30 seconds for the photo to capture. And when you hold it still it jumps between lenses
reviews.potential_idea: Optimize app performance and stability for the latest iPhone models, ensuring faster photo capture and smoother lens transitions.

reviews.review: The front facing camera will not open until you first open the rear facing camera.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a feature that allows users to directly switch between front and rear cameras without needing to open the other first.

reviews.review: I used to love this App but now it’s only saving half of the photos I take. Now I have to repeat work I have already done.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement an automatic backup or cloud sync feature to prevent data loss for all photos taken within the app.

reviews.review:
The app has a great potential but no matter what you want to do, it just wants extra money. For everything!!!!!

You are sticker with a 4:3 photo format and the quality is not the highest your phone can deliver. If you use it, resolution of that picture taken in the app is lower than all your other pictures resolution.
reviews.potential_idea: Offer a premium subscription tier for higher resolution photo capture and editing capabilities, removing all in-app purchase prompts.

reviews.review: Out of several photos, only about half actually had the overlay placed on them. More than worthless, actually adds time as I now need to crop photos with the overlay. Waste of money.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement an automatic overlay application feature that ensures consistent placement and cropping across all selected photos, or provides a clear preview of overlay placement before application.

reviews.review:
Burns me up when developers stop supporting apps with normal progression updates, then want to “charge” for “enhancements”.
I realize developers have to eat, but so do I. Why can’t these people just develop their product - make it a GOOD product, and have its self sold on it’s own developed enhanced merit?
reviews.potential_idea: In-app mechanism for users to directly contribute to ongoing app development through voluntary micro-donations or feedback-driven feature prioritization.

reviews.review: I used to put in factional measurements, since (I’m assuming update) then I can only use a decimal and write out what units. Basically the use of /‘“,. Plus others is no longer possible. If you can make it so I can write 1/8” instead of .125 inches. I’ll change my rating to 5 star.
reviews.potential_idea: Reintroduce support for fractional input of measurements (e.g., 1/8") within the app to cater to users who prefer or require this input method.

reviews.review: The camera shutter buttons are off the bottom of the screen so you are unable to take photos.
reviews.potential_idea: Ensure camera shutter buttons are consistently placed within the screen boundaries for all device sizes and orientations.

reviews.review: A lot of times I get an error message like draft was deleted by other user or email not set up. Then all of a sudden it starts to work again
reviews.potential_idea: Implement real-time conflict resolution and improved error handling for shared drafts to prevent data loss.

reviews.review: I’m been having a lot issues sending the reports to my customers pretty bad
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a streamlined and reliable report generation and delivery system with enhanced error handling and status notifications.

reviews.review: The iPad version won’t allow more than one pic per issue. Fine. It won’t recognize my email, and therefore won’t email my reports. I can’t even email support, because it doesn’t recognize my email,and I can’t find it written anywhere in the app. It’s almost like they don’t want to hear from customers.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a robust email client integration with clear contact information for support within the app.

reviews.review: The app doesn’t always work.  Causing  delays with project goals. Sometimes I have to send it out in multiple emails to different emails and pray that it gets to one of them on time will definitely be looking at different apps.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a robust multi-channel delivery system with confirmation receipts to ensure message delivery and prevent project delays.

reviews.review: Multi add doesn’t work… it’s awful can’t add multiple pics to an issue… too basic and expensive
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a robust multi-image upload feature for adding multiple pictures to an issue, enhancing usability and justifying the app's cost.

reviews.review: just downloaded and i really wish that i saw that this game hasn’t been updated in years lol. in comparison to the new to go games the one looks horrible lol. if u can update the app that would be amazing. i mean for a games that cost  money (even though it’s cheap) i feel like the quality should be up to date .
reviews.potential_idea: Revamp the visual design and user interface of the mobile game to align with modern gaming standards, reflecting its paid status.

reviews.review: I don’t think I’m the only one to say this the graphics on this game is worse then the other 1.99 ones it makes my eyes hurt trying to play it I bought it and seen the graphics and never liked them please fix the graphics
reviews.potential_idea: Implement an in-game visual style selector to allow users to choose between different graphic presets or themes.

reviews.review: i’ve bought most of the papas games and all of the $1.99 ones are high quality except this one. it’s grainy and completely lacking the updated look and feel of all the rest of them. it’s only $1.99 but feels like a ripoff tbh. disappointed :(
reviews.potential_idea: A mobile game development tool that enforces consistent visual quality and updated design across a series of games to prevent 'ripoff' perceptions.

reviews.review: I didn’t even play yet guys.. the game is $1.99 apple just charged me over 20 dollars just now🙁
reviews.potential_idea: Implement clearer in-app purchase confirmation screens with a detailed breakdown of costs before finalizing transactions.

reviews.review: The quality of this game is so low it’s actually unplayable on top of that the game is super buggy and freezes constantly. waste of money.
reviews.potential_idea: Develop a mobile game with high production quality that is thoroughly tested to ensure a stable and bug-free user experience.

reviews.review: I remember playing this game since when I was a kid. But when i bought and downloaded the game it was blurry and the whole game was not clear. It was hard to concentrate on it and uncomfortable to the eyes. Please fix this problem.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a graphics resolution upgrade for older mobile games to improve clarity and visual comfort.

reviews.review: The quality of this game is poor. I play a few other papa games and their qualities are great. In this game I can’t even read what is on the tickets. It’s so bad.
reviews.potential_idea: Improve text readability and graphical clarity for all in-game elements, especially ticket information.

reviews.review: i rarely ever review apps but i wish i checked the reviews of this before downloading. the quality is atrocious like 10 fps and blurry and grainy.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement essential performance optimization and graphics rendering improvements to ensure a smooth and clear user experience.

reviews.review: I adored this game as a child and was jumping for joy to spend $2 on this game. But the graphics is probably the largest standout factor about the app. The quality is so bad, it’s very fuzzy and pixelated. I feel really sad because I was looking forward to playing this game obsessively like old times, but it gives me a fat headache
reviews.potential_idea: Offer a remastered version of the game with updated, high-definition graphics.

reviews.review: I bought it and was dissatisfied with the quality. I would like a refund .
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a seamless in-app refund process for dissatisfied users.

reviews.review:
I bought this game because I love the Papas Games franchise. LOVE IT. I was so excited to play on the phone! But the quality/graphics for most of the Papa games are just not great. The Pancakeria and Donuteria are the only ones from the lot that I bought that has good game quality graphics. 
The quality in the other games I bought (Tacomia, Burgeria, Cupcakeria, and Freezeria) are also just bad. Please try to get an update for the games for better quality! I love these games and would love to play them without the bad graphics. It gives me a headache to look at. :( 
LOVE the game, don’t love the graphics.
reviews.potential_idea: Offer a graphics upgrade option for older Papa Games titles within the app to improve visual quality for users.

reviews.review: I downloaded because I’m a big fan of the papa games and I was looking for some more games to get on my phone but when I bought it I realized it’s a bit low quality and stuff. I remember seeing the game before and it looked way different from that. ( I was sort of upset there was not custom characters ) I then looked at the reviews and see them saying the same thing. I kept playing it though thinking I might get used to it. No , I did not . It’s so low quality I had to get a refund. But anyways don’t take my word for it . If you wanna play this game, play it but beware on the limited play and quality for iPhone / android users
reviews.potential_idea: Enhance game quality and introduce character customization options to appeal to fans of existing 'Papa' game franchises.

reviews.review: The game looks old. I was disappointed when I finally paid for the game and opened the app lol.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a visual overhaul of the game's interface and graphics to modernize its appearance.

reviews.review: I used to play alll of these games and get really far in them.  and now everything has changed and it is WAY too easy to click the wrong things! I constantly have to remake everything and It is so difficult to navigate around .  Im annoyed I bought this game thinking itd be the original.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement an 'undo' feature or a 'confirm action' prompt for critical gameplay actions to prevent accidental mistakes in game progression.

reviews.review: I was so exited to play and I open the app and the quality is so bad and in my opinion this was a big waste of my money and time please fix and update quality please and thank you
reviews.potential_idea: Improve the app's visual quality and graphical assets to enhance the user experience and justify the purchase price.

reviews.review: For multiple scenarios it just loops back to the beginning rather than providing a recommendation.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement robust error handling and recovery mechanisms to prevent infinite loops and guide users back to a usable state.

reviews.review: This is extreme frustrating - the recommendations in the application version no longer match the web-based version (ie have not been kept up to date)!! This has led to inadvertent mismanagement . And this is a paid application too!
reviews.potential_idea: Implement real-time synchronization for recommendations between the mobile and web versions of the app.

reviews.review: I updated the app now I am not able to see all of the options in the drop down menu. My last selection option is AGC… how can I get the full use of the app???
reviews.potential_idea: Restore or fix the visibility of all options in dropdown menus that were broken by a recent app update.

reviews.review: New update is giving different result despite only supposedly adding dual staining info it now gives different recommendations than prior when no dual staining info is available.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a clear control or rollback mechanism for app updates to allow users to revert to previous versions if new updates introduce unexpected behavioral changes.

reviews.review: This app is garbage. It doesn’t allow you to advance through the screens when you enter in certain info (if someone is HPV other positive with NILM cytology.) the flow charts should also be more easy to access. It’s definitely an insult to have to pay 10$ for this.
reviews.potential_idea: Improve app navigation and decision-tree accessibility for complex medical scenarios.

reviews.review: The new app version is very difficult to navigate in complex patient situations, and is not as straightforward as the previous version. There are also technical difficulties where the app does not scroll appropriately
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a simplified 'legacy mode' that mimics the navigation and UI of the previous app version to assist users who prefer its straightforwardness.

reviews.review: Most recent update in 2024 much more challenging to navigate- getting stuck in loops when entering information or having entered data under incorrect headings as you progress through the sequence.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement an undo or 'back' button within data entry sequences to prevent users from getting stuck in loops or having to re-enter data due to incorrect categorization.

reviews.review: The new update is horribly confusing. The timeline makes no sense and my colleagues and I are getting frequent different app algorithm answers due to confusion on how to answer the questions.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement an in-app tutorial or guided onboarding process that clearly explains the updated timeline and question-answering algorithm to reduce user confusion and ensure consistent responses.

reviews.review: It is a more difficult. I was inputting info and was unable to put in the specific results for a patient. Unsure if the pt requires a colpo because inability to input exact results.
reviews.potential_idea: Enhance the app to allow detailed input of specific patient results, enabling clinicians to accurately document reasons for diagnostic decisions.

reviews.review: I have used this app for years. This latest update is terrible. It makes you start with the colpo and make your way backwards and it came to a point in which I had to choose if HPV was positive or negative. Problem was, there was no option for no HPV done. It would not let me proceed from there and was useless. This was on a patient under 30 years old, so co-testing was not done. Ugh
reviews.potential_idea: Allow users to skip HPV testing status if HPV testing was not performed for a patient.

reviews.review: It doesn’t give me management plans if I don’t have prior history. I can’t skip that part. This needs to be fixed
reviews.potential_idea: Allow users to create management plans without requiring prior history, by offering templates or default options.

reviews.review: The 10/2024 update no one asked for. It is much harder to enter data and isn’t intuitive.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a simpler, more intuitive data entry interface for the mobile app, potentially reverting to or optimizing aspects of the pre-update design.

reviews.review: App updates have made this amazing tool completely unusable. Please fix!!!
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a robust rollback mechanism for app updates to allow users to revert to a previous stable version.

reviews.review: The update from last week gives different clinical recommendations with no clear explanation. Did asccp change their guidelines? If not, why is it recommending new courses of action? A colleague who had not yet updated and I input the same clinical scenario into our respective apps and got completely different recommendations… what do we tell the patient?
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a feature that provides clear explanations and justifications for clinical recommendations, including version control or links to guideline sources.

reviews.review: The update is ineffective and removed the apps step by step feature to determine guideline.  Must now look at the flat algorithm, thus making the app currently obsolete.
reviews.potential_idea: Restore and enhance the step-by-step guideline feature, incorporating visual aids to clarify complex algorithms.
